attributes.action: call a general election upon his resignation from office.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
During the last general election, a significant majority of people voting in the United Kingdom may have potentially selected and casted their vote in the knowledge and understanding that Tony Blair could become Prime Minister if his party gained the majority again.

Gordon Brown (or an alternative MP from the current government) should not automatically become Prime Minister - this decision should rest with the general public.

A general election will show if the public trust the current government to take the UK forward.

rejection.details:
This petition overlaps with several already in existence -
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/CALL-ELECTION/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
